Dialogue.NPCText:
You find a disheveled man slumped at the low table, surrounded by empty sake bottles. His kimono is threadbare, his face a map of scars and regrets.

He lifts his head, squinting blearily. “Eh? Who—hic—dares disturb Goro’s blessed nap? If you brought sake, sit! If you brought trouble, sit faster. Life’s too short for either, but one burns less…”
He eyes you with a sly, drunken grin.

Option.text: Are you Goro, the exiled ronin?
You look like you’ve seen battle. What’s your story?
Can you teach me any secrets of war?
Have you heard anything about Minax’s agents?
Tell me more about your past.
Just passing by. Don’t let me disturb you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He laughs, deep and bitter.
“Ronin Goro, yes—once samurai, now the spirit of cheap rice wine. Exiled for…eh, the details blur. But I remember swinging my blade for Tokuno, then for Hinokami, now for no one.”

“What do you want, traveler? Wisdom? A duel? Or a drinking lesson?”
He raises a bottle invitingly.

Option.text: Know any buried weapons near Hinokami?
I’ll leave you to your bottle.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He tips the sake bottle, sloshing some into his mouth and more down his robe.
“I fought many. Saw friends die for lords who never knew our names. Now my only lord is Lady Sake. She never judges.”

He belches, then leans close. “I’ve seen strange things since Minax’s shadow fell. You want war secrets? Get me drunk enough, and I might even remember where I buried my sword…”
He eyes your coin pouch.

Option.text: I’ll buy you a drink. (Give 100 gold)
I actually brought sake for you.
I don’t have money to spare.
What did you see of Minax?

Dialogue.NPCText:
He lurches upright. “You want the *secrets* of war? No man should seek them sober. Pour the sake—or pour out your gold!”
He leers expectantly.

His eyes go wide as you produce the sake bottle.
“Ahh! A kind soul! This earns you not just my blessing—hic—but a secret or two. Pour it, and let the ghosts of old battles sing!”
He drinks deeply, cheeks flushed.

Option.text: Drink up, Goro. Tell me a secret.
Wait—what do you know of Minax’s agents?
That’s all I wanted to see.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He sways, then starts to mumble:
“Long ago, I buried a blade in the old cherry grove north of Hinokami—too bloodied to carry further. Marked the spot with a broken lantern. Still sharp, still thirsty…”

“If you seek it, mind the restless spirits. And…eh, if you find it, pour some sake for me…”
(You sense the tale is true. A hidden weapon may await!)

Option.text: Do you know any martial techniques worth learning?
Tell me about Minax’s first agents.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He squints, as if seeing the past.
“North edge, near the old fox shrine. Lantern’s rusted—watch for it among the roots. Dig deep, or the earth will keep its secrets.”
“Bring the blade here, and I’ll teach you something they never taught the samurai…or just drink with you.”
“Good luck, traveler. The blade remembers more blood than I do.”

He tries to stand, then sinks back down.
“Try this—‘The Staggering Crane’. Let your enemy think you’re unsteady, then strike from below. Old trick for those who drink and duel.”
(You feel a flicker of inspiration, odd but useful.)

You practice the Staggering Crane stance. For a moment, you feel your blade-hand steadier—despite the sake fumes.
(Your Swords skill has increased!)
“Ha! Maybe you should be buying me a drink next time, master swordsman!”

Goro frowns, suddenly more lucid.
“Minax? Bah. Her agents wear many faces. Last year, one tried to poison the sakehouse well. Look for nervous newcomers who never drink. They hate real spirits!”
He laughs darkly.

Option.text: You sure you’re not one of them?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Goro’s gaze sharpens.
“I saw a woman—eyes like midnight, words like poison—slipping through the bamboo at dusk. She left black sigils under the lanterns. Spirits grew restless after. Maybe she still haunts the grove…”
(You suspect this is a real clue to Minax’s agents in Hinokami.)

Option.text: I’ll search the grove for signs.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He barks a laugh.
“If I am, I’m the worst agent in history. Couldn’t even poison my own liver properly!”

He looks shifty.
“Sometimes I see strangers meeting behind the bathhouse at midnight. Don’t know if they’re spies, lovers, or just very lost. But the bamboo there remembers everything…”

He begins to hum a song, words slurring:
“Blades break, lords fade, only sake stays true…”
He trails off, already lost to another drunken dream.

He waves you away, then reaches for a half-empty bottle.
“No coin, no sake, no secrets. Come back when you’ve got one of the three.”

Goro sighs, staring into his cup.
“They say a ronin has no past—only the weight of it. But you asked, so I’ll spill more than sake…”

“I served under Lord Hoshinaga in the southern provinces of Tokuno. Before the war. Before the fall. Before I...”
He trails off, as if caught in memory.

Option.text: Do you still dream of battle?
Too heavy for now. Let’s drink instead.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Goro narrows his eyes.
“Lord Hoshinaga was no fool. He knew the tide was turning even before Minax rose. But honor kept him blind. He ordered us to defend a shrine against overwhelming odds. I disobeyed... I lived. He didn’t.”
He clenches his jaw.
“Exile was my reward for surviving dishonorably. That shrine... still haunts me.”

“The Shrine of Sazanami. Hidden in the southern cliffs of old Tokuno, overlooking the sea. There was a relic there—a bell that soothed spirits. I wonder if it still rings.”
(You feel a personal quest forming: perhaps the bell still exists.)

Option.text: Should I search for the bell?

Dialogue.NPCText: “You’d do that? Hah... you’re braver than I was. If you find the Bell of Sazanami... ring it once for my soul. Maybe I’ll sleep better.”
“Not directly. But her shadow had already touched our generals. They starved villages to feed armies. Her madness spreads like oil in water—quiet, but total.”

Option.text: Then the shrine fell to fear, not force.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He grunts. “Maybe. Maybe not. But thanks.”
(Your compassion has not gone unnoticed.)

Option.text: You’re not the first to carry regret.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Exile wasn’t a punishment. It was a release.”
He looks away.
“But it meant leaving behind everything. The dojo. The cherry trees. Her.”

“Mizuki.”
He smiles, painfully.
“She was a healer. Gentle hands. Fierce heart. She tended wounds the blade could never reach. I was to marry her—then the war came.”
He downs another cup.
“I don’t know if she lived... or worse, joined Minax’s cult to survive.”

Option.text: Do you want help finding out?

Dialogue.NPCText:
He stares at you as if seeing a ghost.
“If you find word of her—good or ill—bring it to me. I’ll trade all the secrets I have for one truth.”

Option.text: I will do what I can.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“My only brother died young. Parents passed in the plagues. Mizuki was all I had left. Hinokami… it’s not home, but it’s something. And now, perhaps, so are you.”
He offers a sake cup in toast.

Option.text: To forgotten homes and new friends.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“You want to know what still stirs my old blood?”
He leans in conspiratorially.
“Sake. Songs of old heroes. Bamboo duels at dawn. And... painting.”
He shrugs. “Surprised? I sketch with sake when ink runs out. Come by with parchment, I’ll draw you something.”

Goro dabs a sake-soaked brush across worn parchment. The strokes reveal a crane standing atop a crooked sword beneath bamboo.

“We all balance something sharp, traveler. Even you.”
